required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Study of How Long Participants Stay in the Hospital After Receiving Apixaban for a Blood Clot in the Lung
clinical_study.official_title: Apixaban Length-Of-Stay Pulmonary Embolism Study - Hospital Admissions (ALPHA-PE)

brief_summary.textblock: A study based on a chart review of participants that presented with a sudden blood clot in the lung

primary_outcome.measure: Compare the average length of stay in secondary care

secondary_outcome.measure: Total length of stay, including repeat admissions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 30 days after presentation of PE

secondary_outcome.measure: Distribution of clinical characteristics of patients admitted with a PE
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical characteristics will be summarized using descriptive statistics

secondary_outcome.measure: Distribution of demographic data of patients admitted with a PE
secondary_outcome.description: Demographic data will be summarized using descriptive statistics

arm_group.arm_group_label: Adult with acute PE before the introduction of apixaban
Adult with acute PE after the introduction of apixaban

intervention.arm_group_label: Adult with acute PE after the introduction of apixaban
Adult with acute PE before the introduction of apixaban

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients (â‰¥ 18 years of age) at index date presenting with acute Pulmonary Embolism (PE), which was then objectively confirmed, and received anticoagulation upon diagnosis of PE and in receipt of anticoagulation at discharge.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults participants at date of admission
- Primary presentation consistent with PE followed by objectively-confirmed acute PE
- Received anti-coagulation upon diagnosis of PE during study period and in receipt of anti-coagulation at discharge
Exclusion Criteria:
- PE diagnosed during a hospital admission for a reason other than PE during the study period
- Patients receiving anticoagulation at the time of presentation
- Patients presenting outside the defined study period
Other protocol defined inclusion/exclusion criteria could apply
